entry.title: My Journey in the SAP World: From Curiosity to Passion
entry.content:
Since the beginning of my career, SAP has always been more than just a technology platform — it has been a space to learn, grow, and connect business with innovation.

I started working with SAP at a very young age, and what began as curiosity quickly became a true passion. Over the years, I’ve had the opportunity to explore different areas and witness firsthand how SAP has evolved — from traditional ERP systems to today’s intelligent, data-driven, cloud-based solutions.

Working in SAP has taught me that technology is only one part of the story. The real value comes from understanding business processes, connecting with people, and translating challenges into solutions that make a measurable impact.

What excites me the most today is how  SAP’s intelligent technologies — from AI and automation to advanced analytics — are transforming Finance and helping organizations make smarter, faster decisions. It’s inspiring to see how SAP continues to evolve, and how we, as professionals, can evolve with it.

Through this space, I’d like to share my experiences, insights, and lessons learned throughout my SAP journey — hoping to inspire others who, like me, believe in the power of continuous learning and innovation.

Let’s keep growing together in this amazing SAP ecosystem!

#SAPCommunity #SAPCareer ##SAPS4HANA ##WomenInTech  #DigitalTransformation

entry.title: Re: installation issue
entry.content:
Regarding to the message "restricted to corresponding installation", kindly note that is not a error but rather a notification that the corresponding authorization "display service requests" is limited to the installation level *. 

Regarding to Authorization level, please refer to KBA 1898762 - What are the different S-user ID authorization levels that can be assigned? - SAP for Me.

Regarding to your issue, the "display service requests " set on CCC level for * but set on installation level for *. This mean* has the highest level of this authorization, which is why the message is not shown for this S-user. 

If you do not want this message is shown for *, you can update the authorization for CCC level as the *.

Hope my answer could be clarified.

Thanks and best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: SAP Build 拓展套件概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

SAP Build是什么，它从何而来？

SAP Build是SAP推出的拓展平台，作为SAP BTP（业务技术平台）的核心组件，包含了低代码、专业代码和生成式AI开发能力。该平台旨在为SAP客户提供一站式的开发解决方案。同时，由于SAP近来推行的清洁核心Clean Core战略 ，该平台也变得越来越重要，将作为IT架构中承载定制化需求的敏捷平台来为保持标准化的应用保驾护航。

 

SAP开发Build的目的是什么？

降低开发门槛，加速数字化创新：

现代企业面临着快速变化的业务需求和日益复杂的技术环境。传统的应用开发方式需要大量编程知识和技术专长，开发周期长、成本高。SAP Build通过提供直观的拖拽式界面、预构建模板和简化的开发工具，让业务用户也能快速创建企业级应用，大幅缩短从想法到实现的时间。

充分释放SAP应用价值：

SAP Build与SAP S/4HANA、SAP SuccessFactors等SAP应用天然集成，仅需配置即可完成对接，更提供预定义的连接器和集成模板，帮助企业更好地扩展现有SAP投资，实现数据和流程的无缝连接。

 

SAP Build由什么组成，可以用来干什么？

SAP Build主要包含四个核心组件，形成完整的开发生态系统：

  • SAP Build Apps：低代码应用开发平台，通过拖拽方式快速开发前后端和数据结构，更是可以一次开发，多次部署成Web和移动应用，无需深度编程知识 。
  • SAP Build Code：专业代码开发环境，集成了生成式AI助手Joule，适合专业开发人员使用。
  • SAP Build Process Automation：流程自动化工具，拖拉拽即可开发RPA和工作流，帮助企业提高运营效率。
  • SAP Build Work Zone：低代码的门户平台，为员工、合作伙伴和客户提供统一的应用入口。

所有组件通过统一的SAP Build Lobby进行管理，支持组件间的无缝协作和资源共享，包括UX组件、工作流、数据模型和业务逻辑的复用。除此之外，未来还将包括Joule Studio，用于承接AI助手Joule的定制化需求。

 

SAP Build该怎么用呢？

SAP Build作为全面的开发平台，对不同的场景都提供了灵活的开发方式：

  • 对于流程自动化方面的需求，可以通过Process Automation自动化/数字化运营流程，如发票处理、审批流程等，显著提升运营效率
  • 对于用户单一入口的需求：可以使用Work Zone创建统一的数字工作空间，整合各类业务应用和信息资源
  • 对于应用开发类的需求：对于相对简单，上线要求紧张的需求，可以使用Build Apps通过拖拉拽快速开发；对于复杂的需求，可以使用SAP Build Code借助生成式AI的能力生成代码，快速构建复杂的全栈应用

但最关键的还是在应用开发部分，所有SAP应用的定制开发需求最后都会流向SAP Build这个产品，也就是说，标准的核心保持标准，敏捷的平台快速迭代。

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

entry.title: Re: How to change the posting date to the current date wh...
entry.content:
At the moment, the logic in bank statement is to propose the Statement date and Posting date with the last working date. However, you can always manually change the date when creating new bank statements.

More details can be checked in KBA 1728750 Statement Date and Posting Date of a New Bank Statement Do Not Get Updated.

entry.title: Re: SAP SMS Configuration
entry.content:
Great and detailed guide on setting up SMS configuration through SCOT and HTTP in SAP! 👍

For those working on ABAP development and wanting to trigger SMS directly from a program, you can use the standard SAP program SE38: SWN_TEST_SEND_SMS1.
This program internally uses the CL_BCS class for message sending — you can either execute it directly for testing or copy it as a reference for your own custom development.

After execution, you can verify the sent messages in transaction SOST.
This approach is beneficial for validating the configuration before integrating SMS functionality into custom ABAP reports or workflows.

entry.title: Questions regarding SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition functionalities
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
We are considering SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition and have several questions regarding standard functionalities. Any insights would be greatly appreciated.


1. Cost Driver Units
We understand that "time" is available as a cost driver unit. What other units are available as standard options in Public Cloud?
2. Product Costing - List Display
Is it possible to display actual costing and standard costing for multiple materials in a list view?
3. Inventory Valuation
We understand that standard functions include valuation for slow-moving stock and lowest value principle. Is this correct? Is excess stock valuation also available as a standard function?
4. G/L Account Input Control
Is it possible to control G/L account input by user, especially for manufacturing costs and SG&A accounts? Can this be achieved through mechanisms such as cost center-based account assignment restrictions?
5. Fixed Asset Mass Change
Is there a standard function for mass upload/change of fixed asset master data in Public Cloud? If not, is there an API available?
6. Internal Order Alternative in Public Cloud
We understand that Internal Orders are not available in Public Cloud.
Currently, we use two types of settlement mechanisms:

Type A: Using balance sheet accounts (e.g., advances, work in process) with cost collection capability
Type B: Using P&L accounts (e.g., miscellaneous losses, cost variances) without cost collection

Both types allow goods movements from inventory.
Can WBS elements replicate these functionalities? If not, what are the alternative approaches in Public Cloud?
7. Liquidity Management
Could you provide an explanation or documentation of the Liquidity Management (Cash Flow Management) functionality in Public Cloud?
8. Asset Accounting & Investment Management
We manage investment projects including transfers from assets under construction (AuC) to completed assets, tracking balances per investment project.
Without Internal Orders in Public Cloud, how should we handle asset accounting & investment management? Are there any documentation or best practice guides available?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Note: We have 8 specific questions listed above. When responding, please reference the question number (e.g., "Re: Question 1", "Re: Question 3") so we can clearly track which questions have been addressed. We would greatly appreciate responses to all questions if possible.

For questions asking "Is it possible?", please also provide the specific implementation method (e.g., App ID, Fiori app name, configuration path, API name, etc.) if the answer is "Yes".

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud业务数据云概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

SAP Business Data Cloud是什么，它从何而来？

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)是SAP推出的统一数据管理和分析平台，基于SAP Business Technology Platform构建，提供数据统一和分析能力。定位是SAP在数据驱动时代的核心数据平台，基于云原生架构打造，融入了SAP在企业数据管理和业务洞察领域的深厚积累。

 

SAP开发Business Data Cloud的目的是什么？

1. 为客户提供统一的数据平台：

BDC提供了功能全面的一站式解决方案，帮助客户减少架构设计和实施的成本，可以快速获取完整的数据能力。

2. 帮助客户降低SAP数据的使用成本：

BDC通过预构建的数据集成，存储，建模，可视化内容，自动化处理数据提取、转换和发布，让企业能够快速获得可信赖的、分析就绪的数据，用户只需要挑选并点击启用报表，系统就会自动完成所有配置工作，为用户快速提供基于实时数据的报表

3.帮助SAP老客户快速应用最新技术：

BDC通过BW PCE组件来帮助SAP老客户保留过去的投资，同时以最小的颠覆性提供使用新技术例如Databricks的方式，

 

SAP Business Data Cloud由什么组成，可以用来干什么？

BDC为企业提供完整的数据管理和分析能力，主要包括数据集成与治理、数据存储与建模、数据分析与可视化、AI与机器学习四大核心能力。

BDC基于云原生SaaS架构设计，包含以下核心组件：

  • BDC Cockpit：统一管理界面，用于配置数据管道、管理用户访问和监控系统状态
  • SAP Datasphere：提供数据集成，存储，建模能力
  • SAP Analytics Cloud：提供分析和可视化功能
  • SAP Databricks：提供高级数据工程和机器学习能力
  • SAP BW PCE：保留企业过去对BW的投资，并应用到最新技术

 

BDC有两种用法：

一种是基于预置SaaS报表的快速启动方式：通过BDC Cockpit选择并启用SaaS报表后，系统就会自动从SAP S/4HANA等源系统提取数据，在Datasphere中创建数据模型，然后在SAP Analytics Cloud中生成实时数据的报表

一种是自定义方式：从数据集成，数据存储，数据建模到数据展示，BDC支持全部组件的定制开发，用户可以根据自己的需求从零开始开发，当然也可以复制一份标准内容之后再进行定制化修改

 

SAP Business Data Cloud和市面上常见的类似产品有什么区别？

1. 开箱即用的标准SaaS报表： 与通用数据平台不同，BDC提供预构建的SaaS报表，专门针对SAP业务场景设计。企业无需从零开始构，可以直接使用标准化的成品报表，大幅缩短实施周期。

2. 基于BTP的平台效应： BDC充分利用SAP BTP的统一身份认证、安全管理和监控能力，各个组件之间可以无缝协作。数据在不同组件间流转时保持一致性和安全性，避免了传统多厂商集成的复杂性。

3. 与SAP生态的深度集成： BDC原生支持SAP应用的数据模型和业务逻辑，包括对S/4HANA、SuccessFactors、Ariba等SAP应用的深度集成。同时支持第三方数据源，通过统一的数据模型实现跨系统的数据一致性。

 

SAP Business Data Cloud该怎么用呢？

对于不同数据成熟度的企业，BDC的应用重点各有不同：

数据起步阶段的企业： 可以从SaaS报表开始，快速获得业务洞察。例如使用People Intelligence应用分析人力资源数据，或使用S/4HANA数据包分析财务和运营数据。

数据整合阶段的企业： 可以重点利用BDC的数据集成能力，将分散在各个系统中的数据统一到Datasphere中，建立企业级的数据仓库和数据湖架构。

数据驱动阶段的企业： 可以充分利用BDC的高级分析能力：

  • 通过Databricks进行复杂的机器学习和AI分析，预测业务趋势
  • 利用跨系统的统一数据模型，实现真正的端到端业务洞察
  • 在复杂的多云、混合云环境中提供一致的数据体验，让业务决策始终基于最新、最准确的数据（而不是依赖传统的批处理或手工报表方式）

entry.title: Changing Functional Area in Cost Center Master After Postings — Impact
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are currently reviewing a scenario in our SAP S/4HANA system (module: CO-FM Integration) where a Cost Center that has been active for over a year — and has many posted transactions — needs to have its Functional Area (FAREA) changed in the master data (KS02).

The cost center is linked to Funds Management (FM) via derivation rules (FMDERIVE) and is also part of Cost-of-Sales P&L reporting by Functional Area.

What system impacts and discrepancies can occur if we change the Functional Area in a Cost Center master that already has historical transactions?

Specifically:

  1. How will this affect historical vs. future postings (in FI / CO)?

  2. Will Funds Management (FM) derive the new Functional Area automatically, and how does it impact budget and commitment tracking?

  3. Will there be any reporting inconsistencies in Cost of Sales P&L or Segment / Functional Reporting?

  4. Are there any SAP Notes or recommended procedures to handle such a change safely (e.g., new cost center creation, reclassification, or FMDERIVE adjustment)?

entry.title: Report showing the remaining quantity on PO blocked lines
entry.content:
In the Purchasing Document per Project application, the report currently displays a quantity of "0" in the To Be Delivered field for purchase order (PO) lines that are blocked, even if goods receipts (GRs) have previously been posted for those lines. We are seeking a solution to accurately reflect the actual remaining quantity for blocked lines in a format that can be exported to Excel.

 

 

 

Desired Report Output

 

We are seeking a report that includes the following fields:

 

  • PO Number
  • Line Number
  • Document Date
  • Supplier Name and Number
  • Buyer Number
  • Short Text
  • WBS Element
  • Order Quantity
  • Still to be Delivered Quantity
  • Deletion Indicator

 

 

 

Current Solution:

 

We are currently using the “Purchasing Documents per Project” app to extract this data. While the app provides most of the required information, we’ve identified a limitation.

 

For any line items that are deleted or closed (as indicated by the deletion indicator), the report does not retain the quantity received prior to the closure or deletion.

 

Example:

 

If a line originally had a quantity of $10,000 and was closed after receiving $6,000, the report incorrectly reflects that no invoices were applied to that line.

 

Request:

 

We need the report to accurately reflect all payments or receipts made against a line, even if the line has subsequently been closed or deleted.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

Current Solution:

 

We are currently using the “Purchasing Documents per Project” app to extract this data. While the app provides most of the required information, we’ve identified a limitation.

 

For any line items that are deleted or closed (as indicated by the deletion indicator), the report does not retain the quantity received prior to the closure or deletion.

 

 

 

 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Report showing the remaining quantity on PO blocked l...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Thank you for your detailed request.

We understand that you would like the report to accurately reflect all goods receipts and invoice payments made against a purchase order line, even if the line item has subsequently been closed or deleted.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the behavior you observe is as designed. Once a PO line is marked as closed or deleted, the standard “Purchasing Documents per Project” app dynamically updates the “To Be Delivered” field to zero, since no further deliveries are expected. As a result, previously received or invoiced quantities are not retained in this field.

Once a line item is marked for deletion or closed, the system assumes no further deliveries are expected and therefore does not retain the historical quantity in the “To Be Delivered” field

you may explore the CDS views : https://api.sap.com/

If you prefer a standard app, you can review the “Monitor Purchase Order Items” (App ID: F0843A), which provides detailed GR/IR information, though it may not include all project-related fields.

 

Thanks

SAP SUPPORT

entry.title: SAP Cloud Integration – A Deep Dive into the IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Adapter
entry.content:
As businesses increasingly operate across both cloud and on-premise systems, they need a reliable way for these environments to communicate seamlessly in real time. The SAP Integration Suite enables this by providing a rich set of adapters that ensure secure, scalable, and effortless connectivity between systems. In this blog, I will discuss one of the recently released IBM MQ Adapter.

IBM MQ Adapter in SAP CI

IBM MQ is a secure and reliable messaging solution that enables applications, systems, services, and files to communicate by exchanging messages through queues. It simplifies and accelerates the integration of applications and the sharing of business data across diverse platforms.

The IBM MQ Adapter is available in both sender and receiver modes to streamline message-based workflows and comes in two variants — REST and JMS (Java Message Service).

Key Features

The IBM MQ Adapter (JMS variant) provides the following key features:

  • Sender adapter facilitates automatic message delivery via JMS Subscribe variant and Supports Persistent and Non-persistent message delivery via JMS.
  • Supports Transactional JMS Session for data consistency and Byte and Text JMS messages.
  • Provides multiple actions for failed transaction handling: Keep the Message and Process Again or Move to Another Queue.
  • Receiver adapter allows reliable publishing of messages to Topics and Queues.
  • Supports multiple authentications: Basic, Client Certificate, and None.

Practical Use Case Walkthrough:

Here we will demonstrate how to write employee data (sending it as a message) to a queue on the IBM MQ server using IBM MQ Receiver adapter and read the message from the queue with help of the IBM MQ Sender Adapter.

IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter: Write Employee Data to a Queue

Architecture for IBM MQ Receiver adapter

When the IBM MQ Adapter is used as a receiver adapter, SAP Integration Suite acts as the initiator of the calls.

SAP Integration Suite tenant sends the operation request to IBM MQ (this is a receiver system), IBM MQ Receiver Adapter works on the request and sends the data back using JMS protocol to the SAP Integration Suite tenant.

Prepare Details

In the Content Modifier, you can define employee details, such as names, organization, role, and salary.

EmployeeId: EMP1005
EmployeeName: Shubham
Organization: XX Industries
Role: Senior Analyst
Salary: 75000
Join Date: 2025-10-07

Configure the Connection tab for IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter

The Connection tab includes connection and authentication settings for IBM MQ Adapter.

For more information regarding the authentication, refer to the IBM MQ for SAP Integration Suite.

Connection Tab:

Parameter

Description

Hostname

Specify the hostname to connect to IBM MQ.

Port

Specify the port number to connect to IBM MQ.

Example as 31656

Authentication

Select the type of authentication for connecting to IBM MQ:

  • Basic: Provides authentication using User Credentials.
  • Client Certificate: The server authenticates the client by receiving the client's certificate during the SSL handshake and verifying that the certificate is valid.
  • None: Direct connection can be made without User Credentials.

Credential Name

Specify the User Credential artifact that stores the username-password pair.

Example as IBM_MQ_54

Proxy type

Select the proxy type as Internet

SSL Cipher Suite

The specific set of cryptographic algorithms used to establish a secure, encrypted connection (SSL/TLS) between the adapter and the IBM MQ queue manager.

Example as *TLS12HIGHER

Queue Manager Name

Specify the name of the queue manager to connect for messaging.

Example as MQD

Channel Name

Specify the Channel Name in IBM MQ.

Example as CLOUD.APP.SVRCONN

Application Name

Specify the Application Name for the connection.

Example as MainApplication

Transport/Network Protocol

Select the type of protocol as TCP/IP.

Character Set ID (CCSID) for Non-ASCII Names

Specify the Character Set ID (CCSID) for Non-ASCII Names for the JMS connection.

Example: 819

Execute Write Message Using the IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter

Go to the Processing tab, select the Message Destination Type as Queue, and specify the Queue Name where the message will be sent on the IBM MQ server.

Select the Target Client as JMS-Compliant and enable the Transactional JMS Session to ensure data consistency.

Processing Tab:

Parameter

Description

Message Destination Type

Select the Message Destination Type as Queue

Queue Name

(only available when Message Destination Type is set to Queue)

Specify the name of the queue to write.

Example as DemoQueue1

Target Client

Select the target client type as JMS-Compliant: JMS message properties and headers will be accessible.

Transactional JMS Session

Enable the checkbox to ensure data consistency.

Advanced Message Properties

Parameter

Description

Message Type

Select the Message Type as Text.

Correlation ID

Specify the correlation ID, which is a 48-character hexadecimal encoded string, representing 24 bytes as 414d5120514d4144455620202020202067d8bf5923582e02

Note

You can also specify an application-specific value, like My Custom CorelID. This sets the correlation ID of the created message.

Delivery Mode

Select the message delivery mode as Persistent.

ReplyTo Destination

Specify the destination as QMGR2.

Expiry

Specify the message expiration time as 60000 milliseconds

Priority

Specify the priority for the message. The value can range from 0-9.

Time Stamp

Specify the message timestamp as 60000 in milliseconds.

Once the adapter is deployed successfully, we can verify it in the monitoring tab. In response, we will receive the message details in the header.

In the IBM MQ Application, here we can see that employee details have been written in the mentioned Queue (DemoQueue1).

Reading Employee Data from a Queue Using the IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Sender Adapter

Once the data is written on the queue, now we will see how we can use the IBM MQ JMS Sender Adapter to read a message from the same queue.

Sender Adapter (JMS Subscribe)

The IBM MQ Sender adapter is designed to function as a sender adapter. In such a scenario where the adapter is used as a sender adapter, IBM MQ (Subscribe) acts as the initiator of the calls.

The adapter subscribes to a specific queue/topic, receiving messages as they are published. A subscription enables automatic receipt of messages when you subscribe to a specific message destination type.

Configure the Connection tab for IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Sender Adapter

**All the Connection tab details for IBM MQ Sender are the same as JMS Receiver explained above**

Read a Message using the IBM MQ JMS (Subscribe) Sender Adapter

In the IBM MQ JMS Sender Adapter, you can read a message by selecting the Message Destination Type as Queue and specifying the Queue Name from where the message will be read on the IBM MQ server.

You can also enable Transactional JMS Session for data consistency and select Failed Transactions Handling according to your scenario. Specify the Max Delivery Count and Queue Name if failed transaction handling is selected as Move Message To Another Queue.

Once the adapter is deployed successfully, we can verify it in the monitoring tab. In response, we will receive the message body.

The IBM MQ JMS adapter is a helpful tool in the SAP Integration Suite. It makes it easier to connect IBM MQ systems running in your own data centre with cloud-based systems.

It enables reliable, event-driven messaging and supports robust integration scenarios across hybrid landscapes across both cloud and on-premise setups. As companies grow and update their IT systems, this adapter helps keep everything connected and secure.

Quick Links

For information about IBM MQ adapter configuration, see SAP Help | IBM MQ Adapter. 

For detailed information about the IBM MQ adapter, see IBM MQ Adapter Guide.

Note: The IBM MQ adapter is available as part of your SAP Integration Suite license.

Labels

  • Technology Updates​
  • IBMMQ JMS

entry.title: Re: Retrieve the task list operations for a specific mate...
entry.content:
For information, below are the key concepts behind CA03 behaviour

CA03 shows operations from task list type “S” (standard routing), but it can also show “R” (reference operation sets) if the routing references another set via VPLNR and VPLAL.

Even if VPLNR and VPLAL are empty, CA03 might still resolve operations from referenced sets via indirect links or defaulting logic. You may need to join PLKO/PLPO again using VPLNR and VPLAL when they exist.

CA03 filters operations based on the valid-from date (DATUV). If your query doesn’t filter by a specific date, you might be pulling inactive or outdated operations.

CA03 resolves the correct sequence (PLAS.ZAEHL) based on validity and usage. You might need to filter for the most recent or active sequence.

You can explore the below enhancements

Handle reference operation sets by adding a LEFT JOIN to PLPO again using VPLNR and VPLAL to resolve referenced operations. Then use COALESCE to pull operation data from either the main or reference set. Ensure you're only pulling from task list type “S”

PLFL helps resolve alternative sequences. If you want to be precise, include it to get the correct ZAEHL for the sequence

entry.title: Install custom functions in COHV (2/3)
entry.content:
Introduction

The previous episode demonstrated how to create and register a custom mass processing function code in COHV. Now it is time to implement the function.

SAP standard mass processing functions are implemented with COWORK<code> function groups, e.g. the function group COWORK230 implements the mass processing function 230 Close.

I am going to copy the function group COWORK170 to a custom function group and implement the custom mass processing logic there. Before that, let us execute a couple of preliminary steps.

I am trying to keep to SAP naming convention throughout all the subsequent steps.

 

Dialog structure creation

Copy the COWORK170_SETUP structure to ZCOWORK999_SETUP with SE11.

 

Function group ZCOWB999 creation

 

Function group ZCOWB999 adjustments

Now we need to scan the ZCOWB999 function group and replace all the artifacts of the standard COWB170 function group with our custom objects:

Find object…Replace with object…
CO_WORK170_CREATEZ_CO_WORK999_CREATE
CO_WORK170_DELETE<Z_CO_WORK999_DELETE
CO_WORK170_EXEC_SINGLEZ_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE
CO_WORK170_INITIALIZE_EXECZ_CO_WORK999_INITIALIZE_EXEC
CO_WORK170_SAVEZ_CO_WORK999_SAVE
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PAIZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PAI
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PBOZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PBO
CO_WORK170_UPDATE_INTERNZ_CO_WORK999_UPDATE_INTERN
COWORK170_SETUPZCOWORK999_SETUP
COWB170PARZCOWB999PAR

The easiest way to do that is to search for the source code of the ZCOWB999 function group for WORK170 string.

Here are my changes:

 

Custom processing logic

As we have copied the function group ZCOWB999 from SAP standard COWB170, for now it works exactly the same way as SAP original and executes the same mass processing logic. The mass processing logic starts at line 129 and ends at line 219 of the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function.

Let us replace that with same trivial test custom logic:

As you see my custom logic is just to log a message without any actual updates to an order. The goal here is to make sure that each order selected in COHV is processed by the function, that its number is correctly recognized and that the function correctly logs processing messages.

 

Testing

I am running COHV and choosing my 999 custom mass processing function:

Next, I am selecting a couple of production orders and execute the mass processing function:

Finally, I am displaying the processing log:

As you can see each of the selected orders have been processed by the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function, which logged the message.

 

Wrap up

The article presents a straightforward method to implement custom mass processing functions in the COHV transaction. Naturally, real life scenarios require actual production order updates, not just logging messages. The updates can be posted by production order BAPIs for instance.

We will look under the hood of mass processing in the next episode and explore more advanced topics like how the functions work together, processing parameterization or test mode. Stay tuned…

entry.title: Re: Connect SAP ByDesign to best-of-breed HCM Solutions
entry.content:
I’m currently working on automating the creation and maintenance of employee private addresses in SAP Business ByDesign using n8n and the ManageEmployeeIn web service (EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync).

The request executes successfully, but the address is always created on the Business Partner record only — it never appears under Personnel Administration → Private Address in the employee master data.

Here’s a simplified example of the XML request:

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <soapenv:Header/>
  <soapenv:Body>
    <n0:EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync xmlns:n0="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
      <BasicMessageHeader/>
      <EmployeeData
        actionCode="04"
        addressInformationListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="true"
        workplaceAddressInformationListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="false"
        identificationListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="false"
        commonListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="false">

        <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>Root</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>
        <ChangeStateID>{{ChangeStateID}}</ChangeStateID>
        <UUID>{{EmployeeUUID}}</UUID>

        <AddressInformation actionCode="04">
          <ValidityPeriod>
            <StartDate>{{Today}}</StartDate>
            <EndDate>9999-12-31</EndDate>
          </ValidityPeriod>
          <Address actionCode="04">
            <PostalAddress actionCode="04">
              <CountryCode>DE</CountryCode>
              <CityName>{{City}}</CityName>
              <StreetName>{{Street}}</StreetName>
              <HouseID>{{HouseNo}}</HouseID>
              <StreetPostalCode>{{PostalCode}}</StreetPostalCode>
            </PostalAddress>
          </Address>
        </AddressInformation>

      </EmployeeData>
    </n0:EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

The service responds without errors, but the resulting address always has usage type XXDEFAULT and is only visible under the Business Partner data.

When creating the same address manually via Personnel Administration, the system automatically sets:

ProtectedIndicator = true

AddressUsageCode = HCM001 (Employee private address)

DefaultIndicator = true

However, these attributes don’t seem to be available in the ManageEmployeeIn WSDL — neither under EmployeePrivateAddressInformation nor within PostalAddress.

My questions:

How can a private address (HCM001) be created correctly so that it appears under Personnel Administration → Private Address?

Is this possible at all via ManageEmployeeIn, or should another interface (e.g. ManageBusinessPartnerIn or a dedicated HR service) be used instead?

Any insights or a working XML example would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Marketplace App UX Design Guidelines for SAP Users
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently exploring how to design and optimize Marketplace apps (or plug-ins) that integrate with SAP systems, and I'd love to gather insights from the community on user experience (UX) best practices specific to SAP users. I've noticed that while SAP provides extensive functionality, UX expectations can differ greatly from those of users in other enterprise platforms.

Many SAP users value clarity, consistency, and workflow efficiency over flashy design — but I'm curious how others have balanced usability with SAP’s complex interfaces. Here are a few things I'd love to discuss:

1. What UX principles or design guidelines have you found most effective when building apps for SAP users?
2. How do you ensure visual and functional consistency with the SAP native interface?
3. Are there any common UX pitfalls (navigation issues, data overload, confusing layouts) to avoid when integrating with SAP?
4. Do you follow SAP Fiori design guidelines, or do you adapt them to fit Marketplace or third-party app environments?
5. Any examples of well-designed SAP-integrated Marketplace apps that you think set a strong standard?

I'm hoping this thread can serve as a space for designers, developers, and product teams to share design standards, frameworks, and real-world lessons that improve the SAP user experience.

Thanks in advance for your insights; your experiences could really help shape a more consistent and intuitive design approach for SAP users across Marketplace solutions.

entry.title: Re: Inspection for delivery saved with warnings; see logM...
entry.content:
Go to SU3 or SU01, and look for parameters like WERKS, QALS, QMAT, QINSP (quality-related). Compare with a working user, even one missing or misconfigured parameter can cause unexpected behavior.

In MSR_INSPWH, users can save personal variants or layouts. Ask the affected user to reset their layout (via Settings → Layout → Manage). Try running the transaction with no variant selected.

Go to SLG1, input Object as MSR_INSP, Subobject as INSPECTION. Enter the affected user ID and date range. This will show the exact warning message and context — often pointing to missing data or failed logic.

entry.title: Re: Do we have a web service for create new employee ?
entry.content:
I’m currently working on automating the creation and maintenance of employee private addresses in SAP Business ByDesign using n8n and the ManageEmployeeIn web service (EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync).

The request executes successfully, but the address is always created on the Business Partner record only — it never appears under Personnel Administration → Private Address in the employee master data.

Here’s a simplified example of the XML request:

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <soapenv:Header/>
  <soapenv:Body>
    <n0:EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync xmlns:n0="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
      <EmployeeData actionCode="04">
        <UUID>{{EmployeeUUID}}</UUID>
        <AddressInformation actionCode="04">
          <ValidityPeriod>
            <StartDate>{{Today}}</StartDate>
            <EndDate>9999-12-31</EndDate>
          </ValidityPeriod>
          <Address actionCode="04">
            <PostalAddress actionCode="04">
              <CountryCode>DE</CountryCode>
              <CityName>{{City}}</CityName>
              <StreetName>{{Street}}</StreetName>
              <HouseID>{{HouseNo}}</HouseID>
              <StreetPostalCode>{{PostalCode}}</StreetPostalCode>
            </PostalAddress>
          </Address>
        </AddressInformation>
      </EmployeeData>
    </n0:EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

The service responds without errors, but the resulting address always has usage type XXDEFAULT and is only visible under the Business Partner data.

When creating the same address manually via Personnel Administration, the system automatically sets:

ProtectedIndicator = true

AddressUsageCode = HCM001 (Employee private address)

DefaultIndicator = true

However, these attributes don’t seem to be available in the ManageEmployeeIn WSDL — neither under EmployeePrivateAddressInformation nor within PostalAddress.

My questions:

How can a private address (HCM001) be created correctly so that it appears under Personnel Administration → Private Address?

Is this possible at all via ManageEmployeeIn, or should another interface (e.g. ManageBusinessPartnerIn or a dedicated HR service) be used instead?

Any insights or a working XML example would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Dynamic Multilevel approval Workflow using Block Step
entry.content:
Hi everyone, my requirement is a bit off topic but is of a workflow where I am stuck. Its an approval worflow on Sale order and is working fine. the only issue I am facing is that its not holding on the approvers (which i am fetching from a Z table). Its getting thrown in all approvers inbox but if any of the approvers approve, the WI is executed. I want it to check the approvers ( Max 3 levels are maintained in table) and until the last approvers doesnt approve, it should not get executed, whereas executed immediately when rejected on any level. In my user decision, I have a rule defined which has an FM running. Kindly guide me to resolve this. TIA

FM:
FUNCTION zfm_rule_so.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  TABLES
*"      actor_tab STRUCTURE  swhaactor
*"      ac_container STRUCTURE  swcont
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  DATA: wa_actor     TYPE swhactor,
        wa_container TYPE swcont,
        lv_lines     TYPE i,
        lv_vbeln     TYPE vbak-vbeln,
        lv_vtweg     TYPE vbak-vtweg,
        lt_approvers TYPE TABLE OF zso_iq,
        wa_approver  TYPE zso_iq,
        lv_decision  TYPE char1,       " Decision from WF (A/R/P)
        lv_objnr     TYPE jest-objnr,  " Object number for status mgmt
        lv_sts       TYPE jsto-stsma.  " User status to be set

  "------------------------------------------------
  " 1. Read Sales Order number from WF container
  "------------------------------------------------
  READ TABLE ac_container INTO wa_container WITH KEY element = 'SO_N'.
  IF sy-subrc = 0 AND wa_container-value IS NOT INITIAL.
    lv_vbeln = wa_container-value.

    "------------------------------------------------
    " 2. Get approvers from custom Z-table
    "------------------------------------------------
    SELECT SINGLE vtweg
      INTO lv_vtweg
      FROM vbak
      WHERE vbeln = lv_vbeln.

    SELECT *
      INTO TABLE lt_approvers
      FROM zso_iq
      WHERE dist_ch = lv_vtweg
      ORDER BY level_app ASCENDING.

    LOOP AT lt_approvers INTO wa_approver.
      CLEAR wa_actor.
      wa_actor-otype = 'US'.
      wa_actor-objid = wa_approver-userid.
      APPEND wa_actor TO actor_tab.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

  " Remove duplicates
  DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM actor_tab COMPARING objid.

  " Raise exception if no approvers found
  DESCRIBE TABLE actor_tab LINES lv_lines.
  IF lv_lines = 0.
    RAISE nobody_found.
  ENDIF.

entry.title: Enhancing SAP Business Events with Custom Payload Fields using RAP
entry.content:
Introduction

When working with SAP Event Mesh and business partner events, you might encounter scenarios where the default event payload contains only basic information, such as the Business Partner ID.

Below topic is configured in /N/IWXBE/OUTBOUND_CFG

Create BP

Check /IWXBE/EVENT_MONITOR

You see only Business partner ID in the payload.

However, business requirements often demand additional contextual data like first name and last name to be included in the event payload. This blog post demonstrates how to enrich SAP business partner events with custom fields using derived events.

The Challenge

By default, when a Business Partner is created or modified in SAP S/4HANA, the outbound event payload typically contains only the Business Partner number. While this is sufficient for basic integrations, many real-world scenarios require additional information to avoid unnecessary callback requests to the source system.

Solution Overview

We can leverage SAP's event binding mechanism and receiver function modules to create derived events that include custom fields in the payload. This approach allows us to:

  • Enhance event payloads with additional business data
  • Reduce the need for subsequent API calls
  • Improve integration performance and efficiency
  • Maintain clean separation between standard and custom logic

Implementation Steps

Step 1: Create Abstract entity

define abstract entity Z_ABSTRACT_ENTITY_BP
{
  businesspartner : abap.char(10);
}

Step 2: Create root view entity with the field which you want to add in the payload.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Add fields to standard Business Event Payload'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
define root view entity Z_CUSTOM_PAYLOAD_BP
  as select from but000
{
  key name_first,
  key name_last
}

Step 3: Create behavior definition and behavior implementation class as shown below.

managed implementation in class zbp_custom_payload_bp unique;
strict ( 2 );

define behavior for Z_CUSTOM_PAYLOAD_BP //alias <alias_name>
persistent table but000
lock master
authorization master ( instance )
{
  event bpchanged parameter Z_ABSTRACT_ENTITY_BP;
  event bpcreated parameter Z_ABSTRACT_ENTITY_BP;
}
CLASS zbp_custom_payload_bp DEFINITION PUBLIC ABSTRACT FINAL FOR BEHAVIOR OF z_custom_payload_bp.
  TYPES: tt_events_change        TYPE TABLE FOR EVENT z_custom_payload_bp~bpchanged,
         tt_events_create TYPE TABLE FOR EVENT z_custom_payload_bp~bpcreated.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:raise_bp_changed
      IMPORTING it_events TYPE tt_events_change,
      raise_bp_created IMPORTING it_events TYPE tt_events_create.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zbp_custom_payload_bp IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD raise_bp_changed.
    lcl_event_handler=>on_bp_changed( it_events ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD raise_bp_created.
    lcl_event_handler=>on_bp_created( it_events ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

In local types of Behavior implementation class,

CLASS lcl_event_handler DEFINITION FRIENDS zbp_addr_changed.

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS: on_bp_changed IMPORTING it_events TYPE zbp_custom_payload_bp=>tt_events_change,
      on_bp_created IMPORTING it_events TYPE zbp_custom_payload_bp=>tt_events_create.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_event_handler IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD on_bp_changed.
    RAISE ENTITY EVENT z_custom_payload_bp~bpchanged FROM it_events.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD on_bp_created.
    RAISE ENTITY EVENT z_custom_payload_bp~bpcreated FROM it_events.

  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

Step 4: Create Custom Event Definition

Step 5: Configure custom event in the outbound bindings

Step 6: Create receiver function module

This will intercept the standard Business Partner event and raise the derived event with enhanced payload:

FUNCTION ztest_bp_receiver_fm.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     VALUE(EVENT) LIKE  SWETYPECOU-EVENT
*"     VALUE(RECTYPE) LIKE  SWETYPECOU-RECTYPE
*"     VALUE(OBJTYPE) LIKE  SWETYPECOU-OBJTYPE
*"     VALUE(OBJKEY) LIKE  SWEINSTCOU-OBJKEY
*"  EXPORTING
*"     VALUE(REC_ID) LIKE  SWELOG-RECID
*"  TABLES
*"      EVENT_CONTAINER STRUCTURE  SWCONT
*"  EXCEPTIONS
*"      READ_FAILED
*"      CREATE_FAILED
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
  SELECT SINGLE name_first,name_last FROM but000 WHERE partner = @objkey INTO (ls_bp).
  IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
    zbp_custom_payload_bp=>raise_bp_changed( it_events = VALUE #( (
                                                         name_first = ls_bp-name_first
                                                         name_last = ls_bp-name_last
                                                         %param = VALUE #( businesspartner = objkey )
                                                         ) ) ).

  ENDIF.

ENDFUNCTION.

Step 7: Register Event Linkage

Link the standard Business Partner event to your receiver function module using transaction SWE2:

  1. Execute transaction SWE2
  2. Create a new entry with:
    • Object Type: Business Partner object type (e.g., BUS1006)
    • Event: The standard event (e.g., CHANGED)
    • Receiver Type: Function Module
    • Receiver Function Module: ZTEST_BP_RECEIVER_FM
  3. Save the configuration

Step 8: Test the Implementation

Now it's time to verify that everything works as expected:

  1. Modify an existing Business Partner (change any field)

 

2. Navigate to /N/IWXBE/EVENT_MONITOR

  1. Locate your derived event in the event list
  2. Examine the payload

 

You should now see an enriched payload containing:

json

 {

 "name_first": "Derived events",

 "name_last": "Demo",

 "businesspartner": "0001000260"

}

Important Note for BP Creation Events:

If you want to trigger the derived event at the time of Business Partner creation, you need to add an additional entry in SWE2 for the CREATED event. You have two options:

Option 1: Same Payload for Both Events If the payload structure is identical for both creation and modification events, you can use the same receiver function module for both events:

  • Create an entry in SWE2 for event CREATED pointing to ZTEST_BP_RECEIVER_FM
  • Create an entry in SWE2 for event CHANGED pointing to ZTEST_BP_RECEIVER_FM

Option 2: Different PayloadsIf you require different payload structures for creation and modification events, perform the following:

  • Create a separate receiver function module (e.g., ZTEST_BP_RECEIVER_CREATE_FM) for the creation event
  • Implement the custom logic for the creation payload
  • Add a separate entry in SWE2 for event CREATED pointing to the new function module
  • Keep the existing entry for CHANGED event pointing to ZTEST_BP_RECEIVER_FM

Best Practices

  • Always handle database read errors gracefully
  • Consider performance implications when querying large datasets
  • Document your custom events clearly for API consumers
  • Use meaningful naming conventions for custom events and function modules
  • Test thoroughly in development before deploying to production
  • Monitor event processing to ensure reliability

Conclusion

Derived events provide a powerful mechanism to enhance standard SAP events with custom business data. By following the steps outlined in this blog post, you can significantly improve the value of your event-driven integrations without modifying standard SAP objects.

This approach maintains clean separation between standard and custom code while providing the flexibility needed for real-world integration scenarios. Whether you're building microservices, integrating with external systems, or creating event-driven architectures, enriched event payloads will help you build more efficient and maintainable solutions.

Additional Resources

  • Steps to publish business events 

Have you implemented derived events in your SAP landscape? Share your experiences and questions in the comments below!

Event-driven architecture SAP Event Mesh

entry.title: Re: Guidelines for content created with generative AI
entry.content:
@KjetilKilhavn I do appreciate your response and take your points. However:

  1. SAP employees are already clearly identified with a little SAP logo badge. Thus, I don't think "SAP Champion" creates any confusion. Here SAP means more of a expertise area not affiliation or employer.
  2. Community leaders are very often topic experts too. One needs to have some expertise to share knowledge and knowledge sharing is what the SAP community is mostly about.
  3. We are here in SAP community, not a local archery or a school band. Therefore it does make sense to keep SAP in the badge title. Once the badge is displayed on e.g. LinkedIn clear information on what kind of community one excels in is valuable.

Still, these is just my point of view. We are different people, perfectly entitled to various positions. It is good to have them and be able to freely discuss them.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: How to include the stock available in cross plant during the MRP run
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are currently facing an issue with our MRP run. The system is not considering available stock in other plants during the MRP execution. As a result, it shows a shortfall and unnecessarily raises purchase requisitions, even though the required material is actually available in one of our other plants.

To address this, we would like to explore the feasibility of running MRP across multiple plants based on user selection. This would help in optimizing stock utilization across locations and avoiding redundant procurement.

Could you please suggest how to enable this functionality or suggest an alternative approach to achieve this?

Thanks in advance. 

Best Regards,

Dinesh

entry.title: Next Generation Just-In-Time, Supply to Customer - Example in System
entry.content:
In previous blog (Next Generation Just-In-Time, Supply to Customer -... - SAP Community), we made a brief introduction to Next Generation JIT S2C solution. In this blog, I would like to show how system run by testing in SAP internal S/4HANA Cloud Public edition system.

We still take the sequenced JIT call business in automobile industry as an example. After we confirm all the related master data are prepared, we test in system by reference the main process described in previous overview blog:

  1. Create the customer JIT Call manually by Fiori App Manage Customer JIT Calls

You specify the External JIT Call Number (This can be from customer), Customer Vehicle Number, Customer Vehicle Model and other customer information. These cover all the request information from customer.

Component Groups will be automatically determined after you added new components.

In App Monitor Customer JIT Calls, you may check all the created JIT Calls with the status showed.

  1. Following most actions related to JIT Calls can all be executed in App Manage Customer JIT Calls By Component Groups.

Select your Teams Name, appropriate functions that could be performed by this team are displayed. Click the action button to perform corresponding actions.

The first action is Create Packing Group:

After the action being successfully executed, you may check the application log by clicking the Application Log on the same screen.

The application log detail will tell you what happened to this JIT call by this action.

Now the Packing Group is created based on the package specification defined, and you will find the new created packing group in the component group information of JIT Call:

The Internal Processing Status was changed from JIT Call Created(0100) to Packing Group Allocated (0130):

Since we will supply the customer JIT request with production. Now we release the JIT call to production:

Updated status also displayed on the same screen:

Packing Group Status updated too:

After the production completed, we perform the confirmation by clicking Confirm Production:

Goods movement posted while performing the production confirmation with movement type 261 for component consumption and movement type 131 for product receiving.

  1. The we perform packing related actions here: Release to Packing, Confirm Packing, Create Handling Unit from Package Group, Create Outbound Delivery.

After the outbound delivery created, We can see the delivery number on the JIT call Component screen:

We perform picking via App Pick Outbound Delivery:

Outbound Deliveries for Goods Issue:

Material document with movement type 601 generated after goods issue posting:

  1. Then we create billing document via App Create Billing Documents.

Now we will see the status of all actions on the customer JIT Call are completed:

We have some reports for the insights of Just-In-Time Processing. You may use Demand Analysis for Customer JIT Calls to compare the Customer JIT Calls and schedule line from forecast delivery schedules.

Use Analyze stock availability for Customer JIT Calls to compare JIT Call request quantities and available stock quantities.
